## TransportOptions.abortKey property

Which can be passed to `client.abortByKey(abortKey)`<!-- -->. Many requests can share the same `abortKey`<!-- -->, so that they can be aborted at once.

**Signature:**

```typescript
abortKey?: string;
```

## Remarks

This may be useful in frontend within React or VueJS. You can specify a unified `abortKey` to requests in a component, and abort them when the component is destroying.

## Example


```ts
// Send API request many times
client.callApi('SendData', { data: 'AAA' }, { abortKey: 'Session#123' });
client.callApi('SendData', { data: 'BBB' }, { abortKey: 'Session#123' });
client.callApi('SendData', { data: 'CCC' }, { abortKey: 'Session#123' });

// And abort the at once
client.abortByKey('Session#123');
```
